summary: 1) Parent  Direwolf was dead. Horne  of deer inside his neck _ Ned Stark was dead (cut his head)in Kings  Landing by Joffry...
body:
When Starks found Direwolfs!

1) Parent Direwolf was dead. Horne of deer inside his neck _ Ned Stark was dead (cut his head)in Kings Landing by Joffry Baratheon. His symbol is black deer

2) Rob’s Direwolf cut his head by Freyes - Robb cut his head by Freyes

3) Arya’s Direwolf escaped from Kings Road because lie of Sansa- Arya escaped from Kings Landing

4) Rickon’s direwolf killed by hand of Bolton -Rickon was killed by Bolton

5) Bran’s direwolf was dead in cave bayond the wall- Bran was dead bayond the wall ( he said) and became three eyed raven

6) Jon’s Direwolf is different from another. White and albino. He is not like another siblings. He is not a Stark. White is Targaryen look colour . Especially Daenerys…

7) Sansa’s Direwolf Kild by Stark’s hand and Valyrian Steel - what is a future of Sansa?

When Joffry said “ Bring me his head”. Ned bent the knee for cut his head. Sansa lost her mind and fall down.

Especialy in epicentre is Sansa but this pov is Aryas own title. Before this scene Ned said to Arya “ The Pack Survive ” but Sansa isn’t there too. Ned and Arya are alone in room.

Ned’s execution scene is too ( Arya, Sansa and Ned) three Stark and this time only Arya stand. Sansa fall down and Ned bent the knee for cut his head

Sansa lied and her direwolf killed by Ned …by Stark…By Valyryan steel …Nymerya escaped ….Cersei lied and Joffry killed Ned …Arya escaped

THE LAST STARK WHO IS alive WITH VALYRIAN STEEL IS ARYA.

summary: Last Thing I Wrote Tag Game
title: Last Thing I Wrote Tag Game
body:
Post the last sentence you wrote and tag as many people as there are words in the sentence. Thanks to @thescarletgarden1990 and @filhadoboto for the tags! 

“Traitor.” Jon said, biting back a wide grin as Dany laughed and knelt to assure Ghost that he was no such thing.

In return, I’ll tag @notpmahalem​, @freshhexes​ and @hardlyfatal​ (because we all know I’m just scrounging for any snippet from all of you!

summary: In your opinion what would be a good ending for Dany?
question: In your opinion what would be a good ending for Dany?
answer:
Hello anon,

This is a very hard question. My ideal ending for Dany has changed with time. There are are two sides to how I view Dany’s ending. The part of me that loves the character wants her to have that ideal of the house with the red door. That is, for Dany to have a stable home, wherever that is, and to have the loving family she has yearned for throughout the entire series.

However, there’s the other part of me, the Dany stan who has had to deal with years of haters and detractors besmirching my Queen’s name. That part of me wants Dany to everything they fear she’ll get. For her to rule Westeros with her loving nephew-husband by her side, to be the first of her name and to  show once and for all that House Targaryen are the G.O.A.T. of GoT.

What can I say, I’m a petty bitch.

TFN

summary: Why do people act like Ned/Cat 2.0 is a good thing?
body:
Why do people act like Ned/Cat 2.0 is a good thing?

I’m not sure why some in GOT fandom idealize Ned and Cat’s relationship as it relates to Jon and Sansa. First, it was an arranged marriage, not one made for love. Second, Cat was cruel to Jon so why in heaven’s name would Jon ever want a wife that parallels Catelyn? Third, Ned didn’t trust his wife enough to tell her the truth about Jon’s parentage. So there was distrust and a lack of communication. Cat would have been just as invested as Ned at keeping the secret because King Robert finding out would have meant death for all the Starks, including Cat’s children, not just Ned. So I’m really not sure why this relationship is idealized.

summary: Jon did not abandon the Night's Watch
body:
Jon did not abandon the Night’s Watch

I’ve seen posts where people say that Jon is a traitor and he abandoned the Night’s Watch which is simply not true. Well, at least for show!Jon. Just take a look at the Night’s Watch oath:

“Hear my words and bear witness to my vow. Night gathers, and now my watch begins. It shall not end until my death. I shall take no wife, hold no lands, father no children. I shall wear no crowns and win no glory. I shall live and die at my post. I am the sword in the darkness. I am the watcher on the walls. I am the shield that guards the realms of men. I pledge my life and my honor to the Night’s Watch, for this night and all the nights to come.”

As you can see from the vows, you serve UNTIL your death. Jon lived and died at his post. The moment he died was the moment he was released from his vows. Besides making sure he faced the consequences of his misteps, I think this was GRRM’s way of releasing him from his vows. This way he can partake in all the things be wouldn’t and shouldn’t be able to had his brothers not killed him.

Note to ASOIAF fandom followers: I've read all the books, and rarely if ever cut for spoilers, sorry. Please check my FAQ and the other links on my sidebar for more info.

summary: How do you think Catelyn would have reacted if her husband's bastard had been a girl, and therefore less of a threat to her...
question: How do you think Catelyn would have reacted if her husband's bastard had been a girl, and therefore less of a threat to her children?
answer:
Better, much better. Mind you female bastards still get the short end of the stick in society, but without “Jonna” being treated the same as Ned’s trueborn sons, she’s far less of a threat. Like, people don’t realize what kind of incredible insult it was for Catelyn to arrive at Winterfell as its new lady, bringing Ned’s firstborn son and heir to him… and there’s a baby already in the nursery, a bastard, who looks just like Ned (unlike Robb). But when people talk about bastards who usurp their trueborn siblings, they talk about Ronard Storm and Daemon Blackfyre, not Shiera Seastar.

Though Cat would still wonder about her mother, how Ned must have loved her to treat her child so very different than most noble bastards, and that would lead to some issues… but I don’t think she would resent the girl as much, probably pity her more. (See her reaction to Mya Stone for comparison.) It’s Ned who gets more nervous here, as Jonna grows up and begins to look more and more like Lyanna, so that he’s hiding her away from people who would have known Lyanna… Like, forget about being seated below the salt when the royal family’s at Winterfell, I don’t think Jonna gets to meet Robert at all.

For more on the subject of a girl!Jon, please see this post, and this tag.

Though Cat would still wonder about her mother, how Ned must have loved her to treat her child so very different than most noble bastards, and that would lead to some issues… but I don’t think she would resent the girl as much, probably pity her more. (See her reaction to Mya Stone for comparison.) It’s Ned who gets more nervous here, as Jonna grows up and begins to look more and more like Lyanna, so that he’s hiding her away from people who would have known Lyanna… Like, forget about being seated below the salt when the royal family’s at Winterfell, I don’t think Jonna gets to meet Robert at all.

For more on the subject of a girl!Jon, please see this post, and this tag.

trail.content_raw:
Better, much better. Mind you female bastards still get the short end of the stick in society, but without “Jonna” being treated the same as Ned’s trueborn sons, she’s far less of a threat. Like, people don’t realize what kind of incredible insult it was for Catelyn to arrive at Winterfell as its new lady, bringing Ned’s firstborn son and heir to him… and there’s a baby already in the nursery, a bastard, who looks just like Ned (unlike Robb). But when people talk about bastards who usurp their trueborn siblings, they talk about Ronard Storm and Daemon Blackfyre, not Shiera Seastar.

Though Cat would still wonder about her mother, how Ned must have loved her to treat her child so very different than most noble bastards, and that would lead to some issues… but I don’t think she would resent the girl as much, probably pity her more. (See her reaction to Mya Stone for comparison.) It’s Ned who gets more nervous here, as Jonna grows up and begins to look more and more like Lyanna, so that he’s hiding her away from people who would have known Lyanna… Like, forget about being seated below the salt when the royal family’s at Winterfell, I don’t think Jonna gets to meet Robert at all.

For more on the subject of a girl!Jon, please see this post, and this tag.
trail.content:
Better, much better. Mind you female bastards still get the short end of the stick in society, but without “Jonna” being treated the same as Ned’s trueborn sons, she’s far less of a threat. Like, people don’t realize what kind of incredible insult it was for Catelyn to arrive at Winterfell as its new lady, bringing Ned’s firstborn son and heir to him… and there’s a baby already in the nursery, a bastard, who looks just like Ned (unlike Robb). But when people talk about bastards who usurp their trueborn siblings, they talk about Ronard Storm and Daemon Blackfyre, not Shiera Seastar.

Though Cat would still wonder about her mother, how Ned must have loved her to treat her child so very different than most noble bastards, and that would lead to some issues… but I don’t think she would resent the girl as much, probably pity her more. (See her reaction to Mya Stone for comparison.) It’s Ned who gets more nervous here, as Jonna grows up and begins to look more and more like Lyanna, so that he’s hiding her away from people who would have known Lyanna… Like, forget about being seated below the salt when the royal family’s at Winterfell, I don’t think Jonna gets to meet Robert at all.

For more on the subject of a girl!Jon, please see this post, and this tag.

blog.name: vulvarine
blog.title: God released me into the wild, now he's hunting me for sport.

tags: a song of ice and fire
summary: Jon Snow/Eragon parallels: Dead mom they never got to know Father not who initially was originally suspected  Raised by loving...
body:
Jon Snow/Eragon parallels:

Dead mom they never got to know

Father not who initially was originally suspected

Raised by loving Uncle beside sibling like cousins at the behest of their mother shortly after birth

Magic swords that catch fire (speculation on Jon’s end but I mean come on)

Arya (though different relationships)

Mama was up to some fighting shit on the slick

Both have half brothers with severely different coloring

Being extremely young when forced to take a position of great power, nobility, respect in order to serve the greater good

Moody teenage boys

Eragon has a horse named “Snowfire”

DRAGONS

summary: My siblings watch Game of Thrones and forever made sure my mom didn’t know about any of the nudity or sex scenes. Until one day...
body:
My siblings watch Game of Thrones and forever made sure my mom didn’t know about any of the nudity or sex scenes. Until one day we were all watching the office together and Dwight started talking about it and mentioned how “there was a lot of nudity.”

My mom was shocked


Dwight Shrute literally freaking told on us.
